page.title: 19The Bombing of Beacon Downe.
page.content: Some pupils from St James High School came across an amazing story of the Second World War in a very unexpected place while doing their amenities survey.The owner of{Beacon {Downe (955952)}Field Marshal Sir Richard Hull K.G. G.C.B. D.S.O. kindly allowed us an interview and this is what we discovered: On St.George's Day 1942 at 11p.m. two 1000 pound bombs were jettisoned by a German bomber which had decided to return to base rather than continue in a raid on Bristol.One bomb exploded a few yards from the house and the other in the kitchen garden.The gardener's cottage and conservatory were destroyed,there was considerable damage to the stable block and the house was declared irreparable.Despite the damage 14 people survived.
